sentence.Network_en: There is a famous Greek myth in which Icarus flew too near to the Sun.
sentence.Network_cn: 有一个著名的希腊神话，讲的是伊卡洛斯飞得离太阳过近的故事。

sentence.Network_en: Icarus disobeyed his father's instructions and began soaring towards the sun.
sentence.Network_cn: 伊卡络斯违背了父亲的指示,高高地朝太阳飞去.

sentence.Network_en: Icarus flew higher and higher, ignoring his father's admonitions and the end is of course tragic.
sentence.Network_cn: Icarus越飞越高兴,也忘了父亲的叮咛,越飞越高, 当然结果就是悲剧.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 伊卡尔斯(Icarus)是最伟大工匠-代达罗斯(Daedalus)之子,为了飞向太阳,用蜡和羽毛制成翅膀,结果在飞跃大海的时候,蜡融化了,伊卡尔斯掉进海里死去。 原来过分接近.

means.word_mean: 1. (Greek mythology) son of Daedalus; while escaping from Crete with his father (using the wings Daedalus had made) he flew too close to the sun and the wax melted and he fell into the Aegean and drowned
